I now see why lotto players get superstitious, lol
I buy 5 $2 tickets over 3 days. 2 pairs and a single.  Both pairs had 1 winner each worth $4 (yay, cost of admission!), and the single NOTHING.
Uhhh that math sounds off. Sounds like you lost $2
And what I'm saying is that it's because I didn't buy that 6th (4th, if we're keeping sequence) ticket :ptv-snicker:
Yeah it makes you feel like there's more of a chance.
Game psychologists exist and they craft reward systems like that, so you get little drips of excitement.
I don't think this ticket pays out $2 prizes, either
Just checked 4 of my tickets. $4 and $5 are the lowest prizes on them
5 tickets times $2 = $10 spent. 2 times $4 winners = $8. Total loss = $2. Unless I'm misunderstanding?
I wasn't quipping about whether I was in the red, black, or grey.  I was making a joke about how lotto players become superstitious
lotto players become broke. That's it
I buy a lotto ticket 3 times
Oh yeah, it's all totally a mind game.
2 times I buy pairs, 1 time a single
I only win on the pairs
Dunno, I'd rather get some Taco Bell.
Most people have a certain number range they look for
Actually, Taco Bell does sound pretty good right now >.>
Outside of that it's either too early or too late to buy
Outside of that, it's either not enough, or too much food.

Btw, is there a way to disable picarto's bs on links?
I know I'm about to leave the sight
Yeah, bigger pot... more for meeeee
THAT'S WHY I CLICKED THE [redacted] LINK
Wooo, front panel mic now works
Ofc all I needed to do was install a driver
Guess I don't need to do anything about the chipset.  Downloaded DiskMark and I was getting the rated speeds.  Stupid other benchmarks.  You be knee-cappin' yoselves :ptv-pouty:
It is crazy how many drivers are needed nowadays
Everything is piggybacked on something. EVERYTHING has a firmware to update too now.

I had a lenovo laptop at work, the trackpad would stop working regularly but randomly after going to sleep, updated all drivers, all RECOMMENDED ones, found out later the trackpad had a FW update released at some point that wasn't part of the driver scan.
It's crazy. Literally machines have like a couple dozen drivers to install/be wary of, plus FW now.
After windows getting my computer "ready" for 10 minutes (update maybe?) I said eff it and shut it off, lol
The joys of having a new ryzen build
I'm trying to repair some files in my os, the DISM got stuck at 100%
Also, I don't have a disc reader with this build.  Had a nice blu-ray drive in my old computer, but discs are going away xD
So when I built my computer, I didn't run any of the discs that came with the parts
I would think the latest and greatest is online anyway
What's silly is some manufacturers have their own utilities for driver updates now, I always just like to do it old school though, just give me
I went to Gigabyte's website and downloaded the realtek driver directly
And now I have a nice, functional front mic
Also, now I can leave my headset plugged in and switch between the two :D
mutters something unintelligible about digital freeloading cyber stowaways
Alright, looks like I fixed whatever was borked
Another issue I was having was Windows Defender was only scanning 40 files and then saying it was done
I just started it and it is now at... 18,000
Problems aside, I love this computer~
Now if only my speakers didn't take up the line out plug on my mobo :c
Then I could plug my headset into the back, and keep the front cleaner
Do the speakers have a control pod with ports?
Nope.  I just have a small pair of vaio speakers.  Two cables.  Power and audio.
When buying bigger desk, buy headset stand
Also, new speakers that will work with the rear speaker / subwoofer ports instead of line out so I can plug everything in back :ptv-unimpressed
